metadata.bookAuthor: H. W. Brands; T. H. Breen; R. Hal Williams; Ariela J. Gros
metadata.title: New Q1

config.question: How did the boundary dispute between Venezuela and British Guiana end in November 1896?

choices.content: Venezuela, under pressure from international forces, decided to cede their claim.
A combined U.S.-Venezuelan army defeated Britain to acquire the territory.
Britain defeated Venezuela in a war to take complete control of the region.
Britain and Venezuela signed a treaty of arbitration to divide the disputed territory.

answer_3.response: Consider This: In the 1890s, Britain was preoccupied with larger diplomatic problems in Africa and Europe. Cleveland and Olney had persuaded Britain to recognize the United States’ dominance in Latin America, and they had increased American influence in Latin America. The Monroe Doctrine assumed new importance. In averting war, an era of Anglo-American friendship was also begun. See L.O. 21.1 America Looks Outward.
